parsed.internal_thinking: My current resources are 2 Wood and 1 Sheep. I have no development cards. It is the NORMAL_PLAY phase, and it is my turn. My settlements are located at Node 13, which provides Wood (3, 4) and Sheep (5), and Node 41, which provides Ore (5), Wheat (9), and Brick (10). The robber is currently on Hex 10, which is a desert, so none of my production hexes are blocked. I do not have enough resources to build a road (needs 1 Wood, 1 Brick), a settlement (needs 1 Wood, 1 Brick, 1 Sheep, 1 Wheat), a city (needs 2 Wheat, 3 Ore), or a development card (needs 1 Sheep, 1 Wheat, 1 Ore). Since I cannot build anything or play a development card, the optimal and only logical action to advance my game is to roll the dice to acquire resources. This will allow me to accumulate the necessary materials for future building, trading, or purchasing development cards. My immediate goal after rolling is to assess new resource gains and plan for building roads towards the B2 port at Node 7 or the W2 port at Node 48, or to secure a new settlement spot.
parsed.note_to_self: My settlements are at Node 13 (W3, W4, S5) and Node 41 (O5, Wh9, B10). My current resources are W:2, S:1. I need to acquire Brick, Wheat, and Ore to start building roads, settlements, or purchasing development cards. I have roads connecting 41-31 and 13-14. My next strategic moves should focus on building roads towards the B2 port at Node 7 (accessible from Node 13 via 14-15) or the W2 port at Node 48 (accessible from Node 41 via 40). I also need to identify good potential settlement spots that complement my current resource production. Player B has settlements at Node 20 (S, W, O) and Node 26 (W, S, O) and has an O2 port at Node 16. They seem to be focusing on Ore. I should monitor their expansion and resource accumulation, especially for Ore.
parsed.say_outloud: Alright, it's my turn! Time to roll the dice and see what resources the island blesses me with!
